Context:
Program Name: Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design
Code: G302
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 5 semesters plus 1 co-op work term
Starting Months: May
Domestic Tuition: $8,032.00* †
International Tuition: $20,125.00* †
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Design
Location: Waterfront Campus
Experiential Learning: Co-op (paid)
Program Description: A four-year degree that produces designers who can solve problems using human-centred, socially conscious and economically viable digital solutions.
Areas of Learning: Think (design thinking, theory, culture and research), Make (designing, building and testing digital experiences), Ship (entrepreneurship and the commercialization of digital products)
*Tuition fees are subject to change and may vary depending on the program and student situation. †Domestic tuition is for Canadian students and international tuition is for students from other countries.

Context:
The George Brown College offers an Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design program. This program includes a digital experience design focus that covers entrepreneurship, service design, user experience design, interaction design, research, project management, business skills, and emerging digital technologies. It is a growing industry with various applications in fields like security, transportation, education, and manufacturing.

Students who have completed at least two years of the Interaction Design advanced diploma at George Brown College or graduated from it with a GPA of 3.2 (75%) or higher are eligible to apply for the summer bridge program leading to the Digital Experience Design degree. The program consists of 18 courses, co-op placements totaling 420 hours, and two years of study. There are also options for Interaction Design students to complete a bridge program and earn an Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design or proceed with an Interaction Design and Development Advanced Diploma and then the Bachelor's degree.

Students in this program must complete a 420-hour paid co-op work term between their third and fourth years, which can be done domestically or internationally. The majority of these opportunities are located in the Greater Toronto Area.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design Program Year 3 Bridge G302 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The School of Design at the college has a robust design sector with interaction jobs predominantly located in it. Notable training partners for the Field Placement team include agencies like Publicis, K9 Strategy + Design, Trevor/Peter and Relish Interactive; brands such as Nelvana (Corus Entertainment), Rogers Media, Mozilla, Crayola and PUR Gum; and industry-relevant arts and design institutions including the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF), the Association of Registered Graphic Designers (RGD) and Applied Arts.

The work term enables students to apply skills, abilities, and knowledge acquired in the program in a workplace environment or through an interaction design research project or initiative. Students gain valuable experience and the opportunity to reflect on their learning. A faculty member evaluates the student based on feedback provided by the employer. Students develop a digital portfolio of design artifacts completed during the co-op work term.

Graduates of this program may find employment in design and digital media studios, creative labs, in-house design and digital departments within larger corporations across sectors or work independently or in a start-up. Career options for graduates include: digital experience designer, user experience designer, user interface designer, human interface designer, interaction designer, information architect, digital designer, digital product designer, visual designer, mobile designer, web designer, user experience researcher, usability tester, entrepreneur.

Digital Experience Design is a field of research and practice that embeds and influences human experience through novel and interactive forms of digital technology. It combines hardware, software, and design to respect the contextual and situational features of each interaction between humans and technology. Digital Experience Design is continually adapting to new technologies and interfaces like smart devices, sensors. IDEO, a global design consultancy, lists "Digital Experiences" as one of their core areas of expertise. They develop effective means for people to share, create, and communicate using hardware, software, web and mobile elements, and interactive media with no boundaries among platforms.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design Program Year 3 Bridge G302 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text discusses the field of interactive digital media (IDM) and its growth in Canada, particularly in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). The text mentions that IDM includes creators of digital content and environments for entertainment, information, or education, as well as firms that provide services enabling the production of such content.

The text also discusses educational pathways related to IDM, specifically George Brown College's Interaction Design Advanced Diploma program and the Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design program. Students who have completed two years in the Interaction Design program with a GPA of 3.2 (75%) or higher, or have graduated with the same GPA, are eligible for a Summer bridge program to enter into semester 5 of the Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design program.

* IDM is a growing industry in Canada, driven by shifts in consumer behavior and technology
* The GTA offers a large pool of interactive digital media workers due to its numerous technology companies and design firms
* George Brown College offers an Interaction Design Advanced Diploma program and an Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design program
* Students who have completed two years of the Interaction Design program with a GPA of 3.2 (75%) or higher, or have graduated with the same GPA, are eligible for a Summer bridge program to enter into semester 5 of the Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design program.

Context:
The text provides information about two programs offered by George Brown College in Interaction Design: Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design and Interaction Design and Development Advanced Diploma. Both programs include a bridge component with three courses and two liberal studies electives, followed by two years of degree for the bachelor's program (18 courses plus 420 hours of co-op), and two years of degree for the advanced diploma (18 courses).

Graduates from the Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design may pursue further graduate studies in relevant areas, such as design, interaction design, digital/interactive media, digital experience, human computer interaction, systems design, e-health, e-learning, game design, interactive arts and critical practice.

The required bridge courses for the Interaction Design program are BDES 2411: Interaction Design Theory and Practice, BDES 2412: Historical and Theoretical Frameworks for Digital Experience Design, and BDES 2413: Research in Digital Experience Design. Students need to complete two non-core liberal studies elective courses, at least one during the bridging semester.

In year 3, semester 5 of the Interaction Design program, students take advanced courses like BDES 3503: Advanced Human Computer Interaction Methods, BDES 1203 or BDES 2412: Professional Practice in Digital Experience Design, and BDES 3500: Computing 3: Data Integration and Development.

The contact information for the program is digitalexperience@georgebrown.ca or call 416-415-5000, ext. 3129.

Therefore, the extracted information is:

* Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design and Interaction Design and Development Advanced Diploma are programs offered by George Brown College in Interaction Design.
* Both programs include a bridge component with three courses and two liberal studies electives.
* The Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design program has an additional 2 years of degree (18 courses plus 420 hours of co-op).
* Graduates from the Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design may pursue further graduate studies in various areas.
* Required bridge courses: BDES 2411, BDES 2412, and BDES 2413.
* Students need to complete two non-core liberal studies elective courses during the bridging semester.
* In year 3, semester 5 of the Interaction Design program, students take advanced courses like BDES 3503, BDES 1203 or BDES 2412, and BDES 3500.
* Contact information: digitalexperience@georgebrown.ca or call 416-415-5000, ext. 3129.

Context:
International Tuition: $20,125.00* for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022. Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and at later dates. (*Excludes a $500 cost of co-op work term).

Program Eligibility: Only graduates, second- and third-year students of the Interaction Design advanced diploma (G103/G113) are considered for this program. Current students must have a program GPA of 3.2 (75%) or above, while former students must have graduated with a program GPA of 3.2 (75%) or above and have graduated in the last three years.

Application Process: No application required via Ontario Colleges Application Service (OCAS). Interested students should contact Nastaran Dadashi at Nastaran.Dadashi@georgebrown.ca, expressing interest in transferring from Interaction Design to Digital Experience Design for Fall 2023. An application form will be sent to eligible applicants, and admissions office will confirm eligibility and register them for summer bridge courses.

Program Duration: The college has been granted consent by the Ministry of Colleges and Universities to offer this applied degree for a seven-year term starting September 1, 2017.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design Program Year 3 Bridge G302 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. The offers will be conditional based on completing the term with an overall GPA of 3.2 (75 percent) or having graduated with said GPA in the last three years. For more information about the program, international students can contact Nastaran Dadashi at nastaran.dadashi@georgebrown.ca or call the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002. The School of Design is located at 3 Lower Jarvis St., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The program is offered in a new 103,000-square-foot facility called the School of Design Building, which supports academic programs and industry projects with features such as virtual and augmented reality lab, usability and testing lab, Future Ways of Living lab, peer tutor lab, digital sandbox, incubators, prototyping and workshop spaces, and design and innovation showcase spaces. International students can attend an information session or book a campus tour for more information about the program content and career options. Related programs include Honours Bachelor of Brand Design (G304) and Interactive Media Management (Postgraduate) (G414). For country-specific admission requirements, international students should visit the International Contact Us page. The contact information for the School of Design is 416-415-5000, ext. 3129 or digitalexperience@georgebrown.ca.
